title: HSE encourages people to be winter ready - HSE.ie
description: The HSE is encouraging people to be winter ready by getting their recommended Flu and COVID-19 vaccinations
cleaned_text: 28 October 2022 The HSE is encouraging people to be winter ready by getting their recommended Flu and COVID-19 vaccinations. Flu and COVID-19 viruses are now circulating in our communities and as they are different viruses you will need two vaccines to be protected against both. Sligo and Leitrim COVID-19 Vaccination Centres and Pop up mobile clinics are offering primary vaccinations and adapted bivalent mRNA booster doses to eligible cohorts. New adapted COVID-19 vaccines are now being offered as booster doses. These vaccines offer increased protection against COVID-19, including the Omicron variant. Getting the Flu vaccine is the best way to protect yourself, your family, colleagues and our health services. To book your Flu vaccine and to check if you are one of the eligible groups please contact your GP or check with your local pharmacy. You can also check which pharmacy is delivering flu vaccines via the pharmacy finder: [https://www2.hse.ie/conditions/flu/pharmacies-flu/](https://www2.hse.ie/conditions/flu/pharmacies-flu/) Please see following information for eligibility and COVID-19 vaccine course. - 65 years and older, 1st round of vaccination, 1st Booster dose, 2nd Booster dose, 3rd Booster dose - 50 to 64 years, 1st round of vaccination, 1st Booster dose, 2nd Booster dose - 12 to 49 years, (with certain long term medical conditions; residents of long-term care facilities), 1st round of vaccination, 1st Booster dose, 2nd Booster dose, 3rd Booster dose - Healthcare Workers, 1st round of vaccination, 1st Booster dose, 2nd Booster dose - 12 to 49 years, 1st round of vaccination, 1st Booster dose, - 12 years and older (with a weak immune system), 1st round of vaccination, Additional dose, 1st Booster dose, 2nd Booster dose, 3rd Booster dose - Pregnancy, 1st round of vaccination, 1st Booster dose, 2nd Booster dose - Children 5 -11 years, 1st round of vaccination - Children 5 -11 years (with a weak immune system), 1st round of vaccination, Additional dose, 1st Booster dose Leitrim COVID-19 Vaccination Centre is located in North West Business and Technology Park, Castlecarra Road, Carrick on Shannon, N41 D7P3 is offering vaccination appointments this week as follows: Thursday 3 November 9.30am to 1pm - 12 years and over 1.30pm to 3.15pm - 12 years and over 3.45pm to 4.45pm - 5 - 11 years of age 5.15pm to 7pm - 12 years and over Pop up Clinic at Dromahair Primary care Centre, Drumlease, Dromahair, Co Leitrim, F91 VX2F Wednesday 2nd November 2pm to 4:30pm - 12 years and over Sligo COVID-19 Vaccination Centre is located on Cleveragh Road, Sligo, Co. Sligo F91 W2KH (behind Londis) is offering vaccination appointments this week as follows: Wednesday 2 November 8.30am to 1pm - 12 years and over 2.15pm to 4pm - 12 years and over Friday 4 November 10.30am to 1.30pm - 12 years and over 2:15pm to 6pm - 12 years and over Saturday 5 November 8.30am to 12:30am - 12 years and over 1pm to 2.30pm - 12 years and over 3pm to 4pm - 5 to 11 years of age Pop up mobile clinic at Tubbercurry Health centre, Teeling Street, Tubbercurry, Co. Sligo. F91 PD27, is offering COVID-19 vaccination appointments this week as follows: Wednesday 2 November 10am to 1pm - 12 years and over You can book your COVID-19 vaccine appointment online at [www.hse.ie/book](http://www.hse.ie/book) or you can walk-in to the centre. There are different times offered for different age cohorts, therefore please ensure you book/walk-in to the correct clinic for your age. Operational Site Manager for Sligo and Leitrim COVID-19 Vaccination Centres, Shona Gallagher said "The HSE advise on having up to date COVID-19 and Flu vaccinations this season. This will ensure you are winter ready and that you are protecting yourself and those around you from circulating winter viruses and the negative impact they can have. We are delighted to expand our COVID-19 Vaccination Service to areas outside of our Sligo and Leitrim vaccination centres, with the introduction of our new Mobile Vaccination Unit and Pop up clinics. This week we will be attending Enniscrone, Tubbercurry and Dromahair. We will be rotating locations throughout the 2 counties in the coming weeks and months, so please look out for a clinic near you." ENDS Last updated on: 28
